adrFormatAddress: 1900 Broadway, New York, NY 10023, USA

editorialSummary.text: Sophisticated, wood-paneled institution with a patio for thin-crust pizzas and classic Italian mains.

originalText.text:
Love this place.  Stopped by after a show at the met.  Food was great.  We ate at the bar. I really enjoyed it and the food was great, service was great and so was the atmosphere.  I highly recommended it.

Stopped by there a second time last night.  Ambience and food were still good.  We had a waiter, James, that was right out of a military movie.  He was so tense I got nervous.  It was all about what do you want, here it is.  Absolutely no personality.  Iâ€™m not always milking for an amazing bubbly waiter or waitress, but feeling like youâ€™re in a boot camp isnâ€™t pleasant.   Just wanted to mention this.  Happy dining!

Stopped by for a quick drink and dinner tonight and ate at the bar.  The bar tender June is great.  Kudos for a job well done.

Visited Cafe Fiorello again and was as pleased as I was on prior occasions.  A great spot for lunch as well as dinner.

originalText.text: We have eaten at Cafe Fiorello in Lincoln Center a couple of times over the years and always have had good experiences. Today, I stopped by for a cappuccino and some dessert. The experience and service were great as usual!

text.text: We have eaten at Cafe Fiorello in Lincoln Center a couple of times over the years and always have had good experiences. Today, I stopped by for a cappuccino and some dessert. The experience and service were great as usual!

originalText.text: As always this place is the best.  From the fabulous pancakes to the 3 piece meal we got including rigatoni de vodka and chicken Parmigiano to the dessert.  Tiramasu. And don't even get me started on the rib meat meatball appetizer! The only problem is these dishes have been ruined for me for everywhere else.  How can I eat them again elsewhere when now I know how they should taste and what I'll be missing.

text.text: As always this place is the best.  From the fabulous pancakes to the 3 piece meal we got including rigatoni de vodka and chicken Parmigiano to the dessert.  Tiramasu. And don't even get me started on the rib meat meatball appetizer! The only problem is these dishes have been ruined for me for everywhere else.  How can I eat them again elsewhere when now I know how they should taste and what I'll be missing.

originalText.text: Wow, what a delightful experience coupled with a fine dining environment. The service was great, they were consistent and had great recommendations. We started with the whole loaf bread with garlic spread and short rib meatballs, the sauce with the meatballs is fantastic and goes well with the bread. For cocktails we had espresso martinis and cherry manhattans (which may be my new favorite drink), they were well made and prompt. For entrees we had the osso bucco, filet of sole and ravioli, all were delicious. Dessert we had chocolate mousse and whipped cream which was huge and so light and fresh. The pistachio cannolis and affagado were impeccable. We really enjoyed this place and the atmosphere, it is by no means cheap, as it cost us $100 per person, but it was well worth it and weâ€™ll definitely be back!

The pistachio cannolis and affagado were impeccable. We really enjoyed this place and the atmosphere, it is by no means cheap, as it cost us $100 per person, but it was well worth it and weâ€™ll definitely be back!

originalText.text: Absolutely exceptional!  1st christmas in the city is always a vibe and the way Fiorellos worked the festive feeling into the restaurant was enchanting. We were seated in a small dining room off the back of the bar, where Mandy Patinkins (& Placido Domingos) reserved booth is.  The lighting was perfect, the artwork was engaging and the vibe was very New York yet relaxing. Our waitress was the best, She was beyond attentive, never rushed us and was able to  get us an item that was not on the menu at that time which was divine.  She made brilliant suggestions on the menu. The food was to die for, the drinks and wine list *chefs kiss*! The Maitre d was delightful and so engaging with my sons. He had them convinced that they were paying the bill and if they were not able to pay said bill they would have to go in the back and do dishes, had the kids going for a whileðŸ¤£   The overall atmosphere was Perfection and service made this the best dining experience I have had in years. I cannot wait for my next visit. Hopefully Mandy will be in town next timeðŸ˜‰
